storyInfo: As one of the very few geology experts under Rhodes Island's employ, Earthspirit takes on quite a significant amount of work herself. It is not wise to 'personally' bother her on her off time.

attributes.content: Your rhythm's a little uneven here.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The keys are pretty heavy. You're having a hard time once the tempo picks up, aren't you?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: A little, but I think I can manage.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I just need more practice.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You've gotten plenty of practice today. Your form is starting to slip a bit. If you keep practicing like that, it's going to affect the way you play for the worse.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Take a break. You've already shown lots of improvement.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But we aren't even sure when our next lesson will be.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I just want to be as good at the piano as you one day!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You have a gift for this. That day will come in due course.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Yo, Earthspirit!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: The Doctor sent me...
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Hm? Hey, Eyjafjalla's here too!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: I'm teaching Adele how to play the piano.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And here I thought that's like some specialty skill you were trying to keep to yourself.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: I see no need to do that.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Leithanien's packed with music schools, but even they don't force every last person there to study music.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Besides, this is Rhodes Island. It doesn't matter if we don't know how to play any instruments, no?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Most of the entertainment facilities here aren't really to us Leithanians' tastes. Learning how to play an instrument is both a leisure pastime and a good way to enjoy this moment of respite in our hectic lives.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Besides, in Leithanien, you are considered highly educated if you are trained in music, and this isn't something easy to achieve for the Infected in their ghettoes.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: (If she learns how to play music, it will be easier for her to hide her status as an Infected when she leaves for Leithanien in the future.)
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: (I'm not even sure what Earthspirit is talking about anymore!)
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Haha, that tickles! I got it! I got it!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I'm teaching Adele as a kind of experiment. This is to make it easier for me to schedule lessons when I take in other students in the future.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Eyjafjalla's really picking it up quickly, though.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: When was the last time I was here again? It wasn't that long ago, right?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: And now she's playing like a real musician.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: This is only our third lesson. It's still rather choppy, but she can already play the Gaulish piece, 'Moonlight.'
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Even I am jealous of her. I didn't expect Adele to be this talented in music either.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It is things like these beautiful melodies that tell us how wonderful life can be even with what little time we have left.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I think music is really fun. My parents taught me how to play an instrument before, too, but it was a different kind of Leithanian instrument.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The keys on this piano are so heavy, though! I just can't keep up once the tempo picks up.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: This instrument sounds so nice. It has a really different sound compared to the traditional pianos.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: It's really quite shocking every time I hear its sound.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Provence, hear this! This instrument was actually really huge.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I've never played it, but I saw it at the assembly hall of the school where my mother used to be a teacher.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: It was so big, it stretched the entire length of its walls!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: This particular one is modified from a traditional piano.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: There are actually quite a few compromises made to both reproduce the original's sound and to reduce its size. That is also the reason why the keys are so heavy.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You are in for a surprise when you hear the real thing.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So does that mean you will take me to your hometown one of these days?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Looking forward to it!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: My hometown is just a small village in the countryside. You won't find a piano there.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh, yeah! I almost forgot.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: The Doctor asked me to come find you. Wanted me to hand this to you.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Oh? Sounds like trouble is coming my way again.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What is this...? Another geological survey report to be filled out?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Let's see. Hmm... A survey of the soil on the course that Rhodes Island is taking... as well as a Catastrophe forecast report for the surrounding areas...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Analyses of five different soil samples, and each of them requires carbon dating and analyses of their mineral composition.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Did the Doctor say when we'll need this by?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The day after tomorrow.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: That soon?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Even with a team of three professional geologists, you'd need at least two days to handle this much work.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And we don't have that many geologists at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Besides, this pharmaceutical company does not have a geological lab, nor are there any plans to add one.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: In conclusion, we are severely lacking in both manpower and facilities, and this is going to continue for the foreseeable future.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Earthspirit, I can help!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You don't need to worry, Adele.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I'm on the job, so nothing will go wrong. You should take it easy and get some rest. Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I've already gotten plenty of rest today!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Don't you have a field operation with Barty in two days? Just get some rest. I can take care of my own work.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But I'm afraid I won't be coming with you this time. How is your hearing aid? Is it working fine?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It's working well in Rhodes Island's indoor environment.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: And I'm hoping there won't be any issues outside either.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Very well. If you need any equipment help for your field op, perhaps you should ask your professor.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: That jackass may be a workaholic, but is nonetheless a caring person.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Hmm... but Professor {@nickname} seems pretty busy lately. I wouldn't want to add to that burden.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But it's okay, I'll have everything sorted out before I leave.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm planning on getting a good sleep in today to rest up before starting on the work tomorrow myself.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I thought you didn't have enough manpower. Are you sure you'll have enough time?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: You need enough rest and adequate entertainment to make sure you can give it your hundred percent while you are on the job.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And that is especially true for research work. When you are mentally exhausted, you could pull multiple all-nighters and still not be able to solve problems that otherwise would only have taken half an hour.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: That said, I'll have to work overtime for this job. As for my pay...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The Doctor said the standard overtime pay will apply.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Very well. As long as there isn't any more work to take care of, I should be able to handle everything.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Perfect, then, I have a report right here!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Hehe, take care of it for me, please? I mean, you're already working overtime anyway.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: What is it this time?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Just the usual.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Geological analysis for my Messenger work.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Where are the samples?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: In your sample box!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: And when do you need it?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: ASAP!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: That's easy for you to say...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: As a Messenger, you don't spend that much time on the Rhodes Island landship to start with.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Every time you're back, you push all your work off on me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Have you forgotten that we're friends before we're coworkers?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Well, what am I supposed to do? That's how Messenger work is.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Just like right now. I'm only stopping by for a moment.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: You're leaving already?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm not done with work yet. I'm back just for that report. As soon as I have it, I'm outta here.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Any requirements?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Make sure that whoever reads it has no idea what it's trying to say, to the point they give up on trying to understand it.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Professionally written, then. No problem.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Why don't you want anyone to be able to read it?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: This is just a kind of report for us Messengers, though it's not usually us who get to read it.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Most of the time, it's for our employers or the people in charge of the place.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Catastrophe Messengers sometimes hand scientists data for their analysis, and then they will decide with the data whether there's a need to move somewhere else to avoid Catastrophes. That's one of the many ways we work.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: By doing that, we transfer the risk of a forecast being incorrect to the person making the call.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: That way, if it turns out there isn't a Catastrophe, the economic impact of the city's resettlement isn't on the Messenger's head.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Catastrophe Messengers are humans after all, and when you possess all the emotions that humans normally have, mistakes are inevitable.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You hear of Messengers who lose confidence, start doubting themselves after an incorrect forecast, and they ultimately leave the business altogether.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It's only natural for us to make mistakes, but the consequences that Catastrophe Messengers face for their mistakes are far too severe...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This method of shifting blame was created to protect the Messengers.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Of course, that also gave us more data analysis work.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It takes time for them to come and go as well, so the only Messengers that I can help are the ones in Rhodes Island's surroundings.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: That's not too bad. It gives you more time at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: If you still ran all over the world as both a Catastrophe Messenger and a geologist like before, we probably wouldn't even get to meet once a year.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Is that why you waste every single chance we get to meet?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Ehe?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Stop it with the happy smiley face!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You were the one who told me to do that!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: That's right. I just don't want anyone to repeat Professor Bachmann's tragedy.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh, is that the famous Professor Bachmann from the Gurk Private Academy? She's a famed geologist and musician in Leithanien. So she was your mentor!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: My mother knew her.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: When I was young, she came to my house once during a birthday party.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Of course, she didn't know it was my birthday. She only stopped by to ask my mom about work.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But once she found out it was my birthday, she played a piece for me.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I can still remember that beautiful melody.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: She's the person whom I look up to the most.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Did something happen to Professor Bachmann?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: A noble from the countryside appointed her as their Catastrophe Messenger, and she gave them a professional analysis.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Professor Bachmann used to be a Catastrophe Messenger?!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: She is of course more well known as a geologist and a musician, but she was indeed a Catastrophe Messenger.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The noble asked Professor Bachmann to give them a final, explicit answerwhether a Catastrophe was going to happen...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: ...and whether the citizens would need to move.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Professor Bachmann was actually a very simple-minded Leithanian scholar. She was old, but she was not a very shrewd person.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She always chose the most conservative of methods. That's also why, after she conducted an analysis of the area's geological samples, she recommended that the citizens leave right away.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: In the end, the Catastrophe didn't happen.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The citizens went back to where they were, and their crops were ruined.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: They had to give what little food they had left to the nobles and starve.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: When the commoners handed over their food in tears, this is what the nobles told them...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: 'This is all Bachmann's fault. If her predictions weren't off, we would never have evacuated.'
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: 'It's all her fault that you have to go through this.'
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: 'This is all her fault.'
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: That ignited the commoners' ire.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Professor Bachmann was attacked that very same night. They bashed her head with a rock, then tied her up and burned her to death.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Not Professor Bachmann...!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You don't want that to happen to anyone else.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: You want to protect others with knowledge, not violence.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Is the reason you like geology so much because you can use this knowledge to protect others?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: No, not exactly.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: My motivation is actually very simple. Unlike you, I wasn't very talented in Arts.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I have gotten better at Originium Arts after my infection, but that doesn't mean I've come to have a talent for it.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I just don't have a knack for Originium Arts. I'm too clumsy.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You are too humble, you know? If you're supposed to be clumsy, then I guess I'm probably the stupidest person there is.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: You got the last part right at least.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Considering my talent, forcing myself to learn Originium Arts wouldn't get me anywhere.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I was smart when I was a kid, and my parents had high hopes for me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I read lots of books. I was mastering certain basic Arts and their associated theories much earlier than normal.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Everyone thought I was primed to do great things. My parents hoped that I would elevate our family's status, which would give us the opportunity to move to the city.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But as I grew up and the things that I had to learn became more complicated, I found out I wasn't going to get anywhere with just my 'smarts.'
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Even though I knew the theories like the back of my hand, I just simply didn't have the talent. I had no way to do the things I couldn't do.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Geology is different. This is where I could find myself as long as I studied hard.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This is where I can find that me my parents were hoping for me to be.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So, from the get-go, you pretty much had no choice but to study geology?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: No, I wouldn't say that, but it was Professor Bachmann and her geology lessons that rescued and accepted me when I hit the rock bottom of my depression.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It was only from that point onward that I started to study geology, and through each small achievement I made, I learned to love it.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This is the place where I belong. This is my home.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Geology sounds pretty boring, though.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Quite the contrary. Even if you stack all the books in the world together, the stack will only go so tall.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But geology is an endless bookshelf.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Each and every field study will get you a different story and help you understand the history of that place.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Just like they are whispering to me...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Geology is a natural library that has no limits.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: From that point of view, it's not boring, and it certainly doesn't make me feel lonely.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So you think it's pretty fun working here?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: No, Provence. Running tests and doing research inside a lab aren't geology.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Analyzing the contents of soil samples brought back by Messengers and estimating the chances of a Catastrophe happening isn't really geology either.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The equipment that Earthspirit is using is portable, and its functions are simple. It's meant to be used when she's taking samples outdoors.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I've been staying inside with my equipment because Rhodes Island and our Catastrophe Messengers need me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Although it does feel like I've had a little too much on my plate lately. Why is it that even the Messengers I barely know are here asking me for reports?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Well, as a Messenger, it really drags me down if I make a bad prediction.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Your reports help us make a general projection.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: These reports are supposed to be written by researchers on the subject, but even though their work may be professional, they also add lots of stuff that has nothing to do with our work.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: But not only are you an excellent geologist, you're a great Messenger yourself.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: So even...
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Even if you didn't need to show your employers any reports, you still wanted one to use as a reference.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh? No wonder I've had so much more work lately. So this is why.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Heheh, thanks to me, you are like a legend among Catastrophe Messengers!
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: 'The Master of Fraktur.' That's what they call you. Doesn't that sound super cool?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: So all those times you had me do your work...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: All that overtime...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh, right, I gotta take a shower now. I'll leave the documents here
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Stop right there!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh no, my legs are going numb.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I'll hunt her down for you, Earthspirit!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: No, no need. It'll get better after I take a few steps! You should get some rest!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: My leg... ugh... that hurts...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Provence, hold it right there!
attributes.name: Earthspirit
